function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Reflection on the development of urban communities triggered by covid-19","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Changes in community service facility planning may lead to inadequate or ineffective response to contagious disease outbreaks","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Development of non-contact interaction activities may create new pathways for contagious diseases to spread within the community","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact on community planning model due to non-contact interaction activities under the influence of covid-19.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Fundamental change in the concept of community space","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased need for non-contact service activities in the 5-min community life circle","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Varying impact of non-contact interaction activities on community facilities post-covid-19","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Scale effect of urgency in using community service facilities during the covid-19 pandemic","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Non-contact interaction activities may have varying degrees of impact on different types of service facilities within the community, leading to potential transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of non-contact interaction on community service facilities may lead to differential impacts on different types of facilities.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Significant spatial scale effect of non-contact interaction activities may lead to complex and variable impacts on community service facilities.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Non-contact interaction may lead to challenges in adapting community service facilities to meet the various needs of residents in the post-epidemic period.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increase in non-contact interaction leading to migration of community activities to virtual space","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Composite space and non-contact interaction as the basis of community life post-epidemic","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Complex and significant changes in community organization and space configuration","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Non-contact interaction activities weakening spatial and temporal constraints","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate replacement of physical space with virtual space for gathering and communicating","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Significantly different impact of non-contact interaction on different types of service facilities","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"The decrease in demand for physical commercial service facilities in the community life circle may lead to economic impact.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased reliance on non-contact transportation services may impact the use of public transport facilities and lead to overcrowding in alternative transportation modes.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The spatial configuration requirements for new facilities in the community life circles may lead to increased construction activity and potential disruption to existing infrastructure.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased non-contact commercial activities in community life circles","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Change in habits and reliance on non-contact administrative services","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Adjustment of community office facilities to integrate non-contact and physical services","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Low utilization of non-contact elderly care services","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Changes in community welfare facilities due to new elderly care model","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Substitution effect on medical and health service allocation","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Decreased satisfaction with existing facilities","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased frequency of using community facilities","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on non-contact interaction","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased demand for community cultural and sports facilities in the 5-min community life circle","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decreased demand for community cultural and sports facilities in the 15-min and 10-min community life circles","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased use of non-contact interaction for cultural and sports activities during covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Accelerated adoption of non-contact teaching","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Resident demand for community education facilities","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High reliance on online teaching during covid-19","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Worries about the quality of online teaching","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unprotected working hours of parents due to online teaching","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High reliance on online education during covid-19","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Concerns about the quality of online teaching","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unprotected working hours of parents due to online education","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased use of non-contact interaction activities during covid-19","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High frequency of use in medical and health facilities can increase the risk of exposure to contagious diseases.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low satisfaction with non-contact interaction activities may deter people from adopting virtual services and continuing to use traditional medical facilities.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Unwillingness to continue using non-contact services post-epidemic can hinder the development of virtual community spaces and impede disease containment efforts.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the concept of 15-10-5-min community life circle","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mixed online and offline questionnaires leading to data inconsistencies","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Field survey interviews potentially increasing exposure to contagious diseases","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Recruiting respondents from the community without strict criteria for health status","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate pandemic prevention and control measures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
